medical_history.chief_complaint: Restless Legs Syndrome (RLS) experienced as discomfort in both legs requiring movement.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began during the titration of zonisamide from 100 mg every evening to 100 mg twice daily. They occurred episodically, described as requiring her to move her legs, and typically happened during prolonged inactivity, especially in the late evening. Each episode lasted 10 to 30 minutes. Symptoms worsened with increases in zonisamide dosage but would eventually dissipate after several days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Medical history significant for migraine headaches and convulsive seizures since age 3. Treated previously with phenobarbital, which was tapered after an 11-year seizure-free interval. Seizures resumed at age 18 with trials of phenytoin and carbamazepine. Normal brain MRI and EEG tests were reported.
medical_history.family_history: Family history positive for similar symptoms, with her father, paternal aunt, and paternal grandfather experiencing restlessness in their legs.
